Substantia Nigra of CIVM postnatal rat b.Definition: The quenelle-shaped substantia nigra is relatively easy to segment on coronal T2-weighted or diffusion-weighted MRI. Ironically, the substantia nigra appears bright on both T2 and DWI contrast. The entire ventral and lateral border is defined by the much darker internal capsule/cerebral peduncle, which forms a crescent around the substantia nigra. The dorsal and medial border is relatively easy to distinguish from the slightly darker appearing midbrain. Caudally, a line running along the ventrolateral border of the dark medial lemniscus roughly approximates this border.
